column3: You enter a damp cave moss lining the walls. pebbles crunch under your boots. In the center of the chamber. a narrow staircase leads down into a brick doorway. only illuminated by your lantern.

You step into a chamber and see a massive skeleton torso propped up against the wall. Its empty ribcage is big enough to crawl into. its fingers grasping a large sword guarding it even in death. (I wonder what happened here).

The room opens into a large gaping hole in the ground. You can’t see the bottom—just pitch-black nothingness. A strange silence surrounds you. it unsettles you. You keep your distance. careful not to get too close to the edge. Looking east there is a door marked with reddish-brown stains

You enter the chamber. Chains hang along the walls. and a skeleton lies sprawled out near a pile of broken weapons. Atop a heap of gold and valuables. a hobgoblin sits like a smug king. Around his neck hangs a bronze key. swinging slightly as he watches you enter.
You walk into what seems like a completely empty room. Suddenly. a tumbleweed rolls past you. (There’s no wind in here?)
A tall stone door stands ahead. wrapped tightly in heavy chains. A bronze lock holds them all in place.
This room looks surprisingly lived in. A goblin stands menacingly in the center. gripping a spear with trembling hands.
You step out of darkness and into… a bustling McDonald’s? Bright lights. kiosks. and a family happily eating their fries greet you.
A long table stands to one side. stocked with liquors and antiques. In the center sits a throne with a skeleton slumped atop it. crown slightly askew.
An empty room shrouded in darkness greets you. A single ray of light illuminates a staircase in front of you. (Is this the exit?)
